titleStmt.title: A Transcription of Codex Bezae (Greek side)
GA 05
The New Testament

respStmt.name: the International Greek New Testament Project (IGNTP)

respStmt.resp: Initial transcriptions of Matthew, Mark, Luke, Acts and the supplement to John produced by
respStmt.name: the Institut für neutestamentliche Textforschung, Münster (INTF)

sponsor.name: The Institute for Textual Scholarship and Electronic Editing

publisher.name: The International Greek New Testament Project (IGNTP)

availability.p: Available for noncommercial re-use provided attribution is made to the original creators and funder and the subsequent derivative is licensed as ShareAlike (Creative Commons by-nc-sa)

projectDesc.p: This transcription was prepared by the International Greek New Testament Project in collaboration with Cambridge University Library. For the Synoptic Gospels, Acts and the supplement of John the original plain text transcription was made by INTF and subsequently converted to XML and upgraded by the IGNTP. This included the addition of paratextual information, the addition of diaereses, the encoding of abbreviations and the comparison of all supplied and unclear text against the new images. For the main part of John the IGNTP transcription made by the Principio Project was converted and upgraded. The XML was produced according to the subset of the TEI guidelines set out at .

A base text was altered to correspond to the reading of the manuscript, and details of layout and paratext added. The INTF used the editorial text of Nestle Aland 27th edition, while the IGNTP used the Textus Receptus. For the identification of scribal hands in corrections and paratext, Scrivener's 1864 transcription was followed (Adnotationes editoris), as amended in Parker's 1992 monograph (Appendix 2). The source of corrections not recorded in either of these sources was identified by Parker.
This transcription has been deposited on the University of Birmingham Institutional Research Archive, at

revisionDesc.change: Incorrect word break removed from Acts 3:10: thanks to Ryder Wishart for reporting this.
In Luke 8:43, abbreviation changed from 'nomSac' to 'num': thanks to Andrew Sperlin for observing this. (version 1.03)
Correction adjusted at fol.287v line 25 to record erased first hand text underneath. (version 1.02)
Word division at John 8:51 altered; hanging line moved from 4v-19 to 4v-20.(version 1.01)
Revised transcriptions of each book combined to produce a single file (version 1.0).
Greek files combined to produce an initial single file (version 0.1).
